Articles.Content:
OK, so your challenge is to use this rocket, modify it to be mun capable, and land.

Here are the rules:

1. You may only do this by adding another stage to the rocket.

2.No persistence, part, or other file editing.

3.MUST BE STOCK Exceptional mod is the Crew Tank

4. Pictures, or it didn\'t happen: Have pictures of the rocket in the VAB, on the pad, Orbit, TMI, Landing, and (optional) Return

5. You don\'t have to return from it.

6. Post a .craft of the rocket used.

Now, for the fun!

Here are the awards:

Crater Inspector: Land in a crater.

Easter Egg Hunt!: Land by an Easter Egg

Leave no man behind: Maroon a crew, then rescue them, Crew Tank is allowed.

Science!: Land on the far side of the Mun for scientific reasons.

EVA: EVA while on the Mun

Have fun!

Leader Board:

1.Joe Pinball, with EVA

2.

3.

4.

5.
It would be nice to have a photo showing the ship first...

Questions...

1) as the initial staging is a bit sucky, can we move existing stuff around so it stages better?

2) I notice a lot of 'unattached' struts. is this intention or are we allowed to actually make them connect TO stuff?

Joe 8)

thinking of more questions

These portrait photos explain my attemp:

Coribus-Mun at Launch Pad

The crew, Danlock and his friends, don\'t like the first model of Coribus-Mun. After three consecutive failures of motor systems, with three big explosions, we decided to modify that model. Only whitout one tank at the radial motors at the firs stage.

Coribus-Mun II

The launch was good (not perfect, of course). http://imgur.com/nCD1b,l3KkU,Nw1pY,ox8wu

The initial vibration broke some systems. Nothing vital.

Well, the voyage continues.

Landed at 0.020Âº N -27.000Âº E, in the middle of nowhere on the Mun.

Here some photos EVAs before departure from home.

Prone EVA.

Supine EVA.

- K-mon!! We expecting you, Danlock!!

- No! You are wrong!

- ...!!

Well, when the crew and was about to start the engines, Wait! there isn\'t enough fuel to comeback.

At the space center prepare good fuel tank. My rocket Durgunesh it can send to the moon up to 15 tons, but the enginners decide to send only 1600 fuel u. equal 9 T. See here: http://i.imgur.com/UKtQT.png

http://imgur.com/Zn3NL,NOSqJ,iOXO9,hCLOY,8TCeP

Land the tank near of Coribus-Mun II

The crew refuel their tank.

All right!! Engage!!

There aren\'t be any more photos because I forget to take during comeback. Sorry!!

The end.

Some Photos.

You just ignored the only stock parts rule. But still, well done!
What mod has those struts?? Those are nice looking

That was a great attempt. However, you weren\'t stock. Sorry.

1) as the initial staging is a bit sucky, can we move existing stuff around so it stages better?

2) I notice a lot of 'unattached' struts. is this intention or are we allowed to actually make them connect TO stuff?

Joe

thinking of more questions

Yes, you may move existing parts or attach struts that aren\'t working.

Cheers

I decided, before 'fixing' struts etc, and possible changing staging (let along ADDING another stage!), to try fly the stock craft.

After blowing up a few times I realised throttling was the key.

My first 'serious' attempt was with the original crew, but alas they blew up finding out how little throttle was needed!

my second crew fared a lot better though:

link to imgur album

Joe 8)

P.S. craft was 100% stock, completely unmodified from the original download, even though I was aching to put a MechJeb on it, purely for the orbital & surface info, I didn\'t and used just the supplied stock ASAS.

You just ignored the only stock parts rule. But still, well done!

Sorry! I\'m rookie (only two weeks with the game) but now I think I understand. Well, I will attemp any time...

Ciao!!!

Sorry! I\'m rookie (only two weeks with the game) but now I think I understand. Well, I will attemp any time...

Ciao!!!

It\'s OK, as I\'m months in the game, and I haven\'t gotten to the Mun, and I understand.

What do I get for landing 2 ship next to each other, swapping over the crews and getting them home?

http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197964668916/screenshot/1155423501624414481?tab=public

the fun part was trying to keep the 1st stage below the 4G limit that trashes the decouplers..

Boris
Er... hate to rain on your parade, but, didn\'t you read the rules?
